author: Josh Duncan
description: Some of my scripts for Adobe products have the ability to save user preferences. Here's how I save those preferences to a JSON like file on disk using ExtendScript and the Adobe Bridge Messaging API.
title: Saving JSON "like" Preferences Files With Adobe ExtendScript

author: Josh Duncan
description: Making neat little progress spinners that let you know things are working in your cli apps is quite simple using Python generators and context manager.
title: Progress Spinners Using Python Generators and Context Managers

author: Josh Duncan
description: Searching through HTML tables is super simple using  Vanilla JavaScript, a few query selectors, and some neat methods.
title: Search & Filter HTML Table Data With JavaScript

author: Josh Duncan
description: If you use Chrome on macOS and are jealous of Safari's ability to autofill Two Factor Authentication (2FA) security codes checkout this sweet Keyboard Maestro macro.
title: Autofilling Two Factor Authentication (2FA) Codes in macOS Chrome

author: Josh Duncan
description: I recently found myself needing to sort a list by cardinal directions. Here's a super simple solution to do custom sorting in Python.
title: Custom Sorting in Python

author: Josh Duncan
description: I needed a quick way to check off a bunch of linked records in Airtable so I worked up this little script to do it from an Airtable button.
title: Checking off Linked Records in an Airtable Script

author: Josh Duncan
description: Building a search results page? Thinking about highlighting the search terms so they standout? Here's how I did it using vanilla JavaScript.
title: JavaScript Search Token Highlighter

author: Josh Duncan
description: I decided to switch my to-do list to Things 3 and needed to move a lot of to-dos over from Todoist. Seemed like a great project to explore their API and save myself a bunch of copying and pasting.
title: Trying Out Things 3

author: Josh Duncan
description: While leaning about Python Type Hints, I wrote a nifty little function to display cool banners and help remind me about the concepts of type hinting.
title: Python Type Hints and Fancy Banners

author: Josh Duncan
description: Need to generate a valid RSS feed for your Flask website? Using Flask-FlatPages? Well, it's really quite simple.
title: RSS Feeds Using Flask-FlatPages

author: Josh Duncan
description: If you're using Flask-FlatPages, it's really simple to generate a sitemap that plays nice with search engines and helps your website get noticed.
title: Generating a Sitemap with Flask and Flask-FlatPages

author: Josh Duncan
description: Have you ever noticed as you learn more and more of a programming language, you often forgo the basics for a more complex solution? Well, today I was reminded of the KISS principle when I needed to unpack a bunch of tuples.
title: Unpacking Tuples in a For Loop
